intro: Tussaca aestivalis, commonly known as the summer tussac, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, commonly known as grasses, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense, fibrous growth. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered at the base of the stems. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in dry grasslands and shrublands. Due to its fibrous structure, it is sometimes used in traditional crafts and as a source of natural fiber.
